elements.title: Osmond J. Ritland (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Osmond J. Ritland (pictured) was one of four men who selected Area 51 as the site for their Lockheed U-2 spy plane project?

elements.title: Biak earthquake of 1996 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 8.2 Mw Biak earthquake of 1996 triggered disproportionately large tsunamis relative to its magnitude?

elements.title: Mildred Newman (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that American psychologist Mildred Newman and her husband treated so many celebrities that the two were known as "therapists of the stars"?

elements.title: his residence in Dhaka (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Sheikh Mujibur Rahman proclaimed the independence of Bangladesh from his residence in Dhaka before his arrest by the Pakistan Army?

elements.title: Charley Frazier (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Charley Frazier played in the American Football League even though he did not play college football?

elements.title: Edwardine Ordinals (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that despite two 16th-century books often being referred to as the Edwardine Ordinals, the word "ordinal" was not applied to them until the 17th century?

elements.title: local regulation and law enforcement in Brighton's early history (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that local regulation and law enforcement in Brighton's early history was carried out by the Society of Twelve, a beadle "in cocked hat and full regalia", and two "Old Charlies"?

elements.title: Gilman Square station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a lion's head was preserved during construction of Gilman Square station?
